This will be the best puzzle game you will ever play. It has everything you would ever want. 1) A great story and carryover from Portal. 2) A great sense of humor. 3) Great voice acting, perfect for the parts 4) shifting environment so your not always in a lab. And of Course 5) Mindbending new puzzles and mechanics.

Have a Great Time!


9.5/10

My most anticipated game of 2012 and it did not disappoint in any way shape or form. It gave me more than i could have possible hoped for. I was already a huge portal fan so all i wanted was a bigger single player campaign with the same feel and humor attached. Not only did we get that. We also got another co-op campaign with its own story and puzzle, and were surprisingly long and fleshed out as well. Later on they also added a community support so that we can make our own chamber and share it with the community. After a long time i have actually played a game that was genuinely funny and the co-op was magical as it can bring two people together like no other co-op game can. What i actually wanted to say was THANK YOU VALVE for giving the world this gem of a game that truly deserves to be up there as one of the greatest game ever made.

[h1]Utterly Brilliant // Recommended for absolutely everyone; A must-have[/h1]

+ Very gentle learning curve
+ Much more story-rich than its predecessor
+ Top notch voice acting does well to flesh out some of the best & funniest writing in games to this day
+ New mechanics, like tractor beam bridges, colored gels, mirror blocks, and more!
+ Engaging puzzles that feel both consistently challenging, yet always fair
+ Really doesn't ever fall into the frustration trap
+ Co-op campaign is almost as long as the single-player, & it's brilliant
+ Myriad Easter Eggs & plot-enriching secret areas to discover
+ Visuals have aged surprisingly well since release

- Pace really seems to slow down a bit in the second act

[h1]LockeProposal's Big Day Out[/h1]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/bigdayout]Community Group[/url]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7611703/]Curator Page[/url]

***A SPOILER-FREE REVIEW***

Quite simply a fantastic game. Portal 2 takes the original game and expands on it, incorporating more of a Half-Life feel while retaining the humor and puzzle-focus of the first. Actually, scratch that, it's funnier and more puzzling than the first game. After playing Portal 1, I was left with the impression that it would be a real challenge to expand on the game without it being instantly repetitive, but Portal 2 proved me very, very wrong. The scene direction is cinematic and engaging right from the start, the atmosphere is incredibly immersive - gigantic areas surrounding the puzzles simply dwarf the player. There's a real feel of insanity to the place [i](almost reminiscent of Bioshock at times)[/i], a story that gives you an actual purpose and drive to move forward, and most importantly, despite being much longer than Portal 1 - not once did I get bored.

The puzzles are obviously the main focus of the game and for the most part they're fun and full of [i]"ah-hah!"[/i] moments. Most of the puzzles are fairly simple, maybe requiring a few minutes of thought. More than a couple of times I got stuck on a puzzle for an hour or so, decided to leave the game and come back to it with a clear head and solved it almost immediately - this is a game where over thinking a puzzle makes it appear harder than it really is, and to me that speaks volumes about the effort that went into its design. If you find yourself doing something tedious, you're probably over-looking the simple solution. There [i]ARE[/i] occasions where this doesn't seem to hold true, where even upon solving a puzzle I was left with the impression that I must have done it wrong, but these events are few and far between and still manage to elicit a sense of achievement.

The acting is fantastic and the dialogue is hilarious throughout - I haven't laughed quite this much at movies in recent years, let alone at game dialogue, but I was hooked on the characters from the beginning. For me though, [i]THE[/i] most remarkable aspect of the game is the sound and music. The audio is immediately noticable in quality, with each area corridor and texture having a fitting reverb, and the soundtrack reflecting your actions. Different portions of the same room can feel drastically different to eachother just through the audio, and it really helps to give the game a sense of scale and forboding. Simply put, the audio comes across as more clever than the rest of the game at times, which is something I had never really experienced before.

[b]To summarize[/b]: Portal 2 took an already near-perfect game and improved it in pratically every way. It's probably in my top 10 games of all time now. I couldn't recommend it more.

My ony problem with Portal 2 is that it ended. This game is mentally stimulating, funny, and overall a wonderful gaming experience. The Co-Op levels allowed me to experience a whole new story line alongside my friend. I especially like the puzzle maker, as it allows me to design, build, and publish my own test chambers. Also, there were enough easter eggs within the various levels to make me want to come back and play it again and again. The brilliant voice acting and witty humor ensure that this is a game that I will never forget.

An excellent sequel to Portal bringing along the dark humour of Glados and the new humor of Wheatly. More depth to the story and more abilities in this game make it a must buy for those who enjoyed the first portal game. This game comes close to being perfect but is let down by a few issues. The load screens and times are my biggest complaint, there are many games that load much more and take less time. I understand the source engine is getting old and cannto stream level content but this does nto justify the long load times (and no, it's not my PC).

9/10

-1 for the load screens and (relatively) long load times, it breaks atmosphere and in some cases should not be needed.

Portal 2 completely changed my co-op gaming world. I have always enjoyed strategic games, but this is the first time that I've been able to really share in experience with my significant other. We've had so many 'game nights' together, filled with loads of laughter, head-scratching, "AHAs!", more laughter, and lots of high-fives ... it was worth every penny. Thanks GLaDOS.

This game is pure comedy gold.  The characters are so rich with personality and the story is so well told and intriguing that I found myself rushing through puzzle bits to get the next morsel of the tale.  I got stuck a couple of times on the puzzles but eventually got through them once I figured out the tricks.  Overall a solid, solid game.
